desc: NKX3-1 (NK3 homeobox 1, also known as NKX3.1) is a homeobox-contiaing transcription factor and prostate-specific tumor suppressor that is under tight androgenic control (PMID: 11839815, 19886863, 11085535, 9226374). NKX3-1 is expressed at high levels in the prostate where it plays a role in tissue differentiation and homeostasis (PMID: 11839815, 8943214, 10215624), and is proposed to be a marker of prostate-specific stem cells (PMID: 19741607). Loss of heterozygosity of the 8p21 genomic locus, which includes NKX3-1, is associated with tissue dedifferentiation and lost of androgen response in prostate cancer (PMID: 9226374). Loss of NKX3-1 expression is found in prostate tumors of different stages, from benign prostate hyperplasia to castrate-resistant and metastatic prostate cancer (PMID: 11085535, TCGA PRAD paper, no PMID yet).
articles/0/title: Conditional loss of Nkx3.1 in adult mice induces prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia.
articles/1/title: Roles for Nkx3.1 in prostate development and cancer.
articles/2/title: Androgen regulation of the prostatic tumour suppressor NKX3.1 is mediated by its 3' untranslated region.
articles/3/title: A novel human prostate-specific, androgen-regulated homeobox gene (NKX3.1) that maps to 8p21, a region frequently deleted in prostate cancer.
articles/4/title: A luminal epithelial stem cell that is a cell of origin for prostate cancer.
articles/5/title: Loss of NKX3.1 expression in human prostate cancers correlates with tumor progression.
articles/6/title: Prostate-specific and androgen-dependent expression of a novel homeobox gene.

desc: NKX3-1 encodes a tumor suppressor involved in tissue differentiation and homeostasis. Aberrant expression of NKX3-1 is found in prostate cancers.
